instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.PP1V8_CAM: What is PP1V8_CAM? PP1V8_CAM is a 1.8v power rail for powering the webcam.
definitions.PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA: What is PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA? PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA is a 3.3 volt power rail that powers the camera. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no webcam detected
threads.message:
There was a small amount of spillage <RESISTOR>R1275</RESISTOR> and L1275 after replacing them the unit powers up but it wont detect webcam. I have tried a couple of different screens with known good cams but still no cam detected. I have reballed and swapped <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> is present and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3RS0_CAMERA</SIGNAL> i s present. <SIGNAL>CAMERA_PWR_EN_PCH</SIGNAL> is present.
PP1V2_CAM_XTALPCIEVDD is present. <SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL> is present. Any further ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no webcam detected
threads.message: Upload schematic somewhere, I don't have it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no webcam detected
threads.message: Apologies I mistyped <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no webcam detected
threads.message:
Check first L4007/09/10.
Be sure to get 5V at J4002...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no webcam detected
threads.message: Yea all are ok and 5v present

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no webcam detected
